definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: I love it most , making me calm and quiet.
sentences.chinese: 此生最爱的东西，我爱她到狂热，她却令我心静。

sentences.english: The press began to lionize him enthusiastically.
sentences.chinese: 媒体开始狂热地吹捧他。

sentences.english: How quickly their shrieks of pain turn to enraptured adulation.
sentences.chinese: 它们痛苦的尖叫迅速转变成对吾等恩赐的狂热谄媚。

sentences.english: The press-conference room adjacent to the mixed-zone was just as crazy.
sentences.chinese: 靠近混合区的新闻发布会大厅同样狂热。

sentences.english: Now, that is what we call a rabid fangirl.
sentences.chinese: 这就是所谓的狂热粉丝。

sentences.english: She was in a trancelike state of religious ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教狂热已使她处于恍惚状况之中。

sentences.english: A thriving black market helps fuel the Apple mania.
sentences.chinese: 繁荣的黑市帮助点燃了对苹果产品的狂热。

sentences.english: His action caused a wild excitement.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为引起狂热的兴奋。

sentences.english: Well, that just means you like them very much, maybe even compulsively.
sentences.chinese: 那只能说明你非常喜欢它们，甚至有些狂热。

sentences.english: My father is a crazy basketball fan, so I am under his influence.
sentences.chinese: 我的爸爸是狂热的篮球迷，所以我受了他的影响。

sentences.english: That zealotry first revealed itself when he was a teenager.
sentences.chinese: 这狂热的第一次显露了出来，当他是少年。

sentences.english: We have made a fetish of fevered action.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经形成了一种对狂热行为的迷恋。

sentences.english: Perhaps others will cease to choose to participate in the warmonger's game.
sentences.chinese: 也许其他人将停止选择参与到战争狂热分子的游戏中。

sentences.english: From fanaticism to barbarism is only one step.
sentences.chinese: 从狂热到野蛮，仅一步之遥。

sentences.english: Zealot build time decreased from 38 to 33 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 狂热者建造时间38秒削减至33秒。

sentences.english: "Now you understand the Oriental passion for tea, " said Japhy.
sentences.chinese: “现在你领会到那东方人对茶的狂热，”贾菲说。

definition: to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
